conclusion: Analyze the velocity-time graphs of Car A and Car B to determine the initial distance between them.
Find the distance each car travels before they come to a stop and use these distances to determine the initial separation.
Calculate deceleration of Car A: Initial velocity 25 m/s, final velocity 0 m/s, time to stop 30 s, deceleration -5/6 m/s².
Calculate deceleration of Car B: Initial velocity 15 m/s, final velocity 0 m/s, time to stop 25 s, deceleration -3/5 m/s².
Calculate distance traveled by Car A before stopping: 750 m.
Calculate distance traveled by Car B before stopping: 187.5 m.
The velocities of Car A and Car B are equal when the lines intersect at t = 20 s.
At t = 20 s, velocity of Car A is 8.33 m/s.
At t = 20 s, velocity of Car B is 3 m/s.
Calculate distance Car A travels from t = 20 s to t = 30 s: 83.3 m.
Calculate distance Car B travels from t = 20 s to t = 30 s: 30 m.
Determine initial distance between the two cars: 260.8 m.
Final answer: The initial distance between the two cars is 260.8 m.
